revised_title: Intimate Structure of Crystals: Cubic Crystals with Octahedral Cleavage
tldr: The author examines the intimate structure of crystals, specifically cubic crystals with octahedral cleavage. They discuss the atomic packing and arrangement in diamond and graphite, two forms of carbon. Diamond has the closest possible atomic packing, while graphite has a more open arrangement. The author also explores the relationship between crystal structure and properties such as hardness and cleavage.
